body_html:
thanks for the tips. I did the search on StackOverflow first, but I wasn't confident using imports like threading or multiprocessing with custom functions, since they may interfere with tf threadings, can you elaborate on this?
Also on an orthogonal topic (which I saw your reply in another issue I can't find), does Dataset.from_generator() support parallel processing? In my experience, prefetch doesn't seem to improve the performance, and I read somewhere it's not recommended to attach a FIFOQueue after the output of iterator (from iterator.make_initializer(data_set)).
Thanks in advance for your insights

body:
thanks for the tips. I did the search on StackOverflow first, but I wasn't confident using imports like threading or multiprocessing with custom functions, since they may interfere with tf threadings, can you elaborate on this? 
Also on an orthogonal topic (which I saw your reply in another issue I can't find), does Dataset.from_generator() support parallel processing? In my experience, prefetch doesn't seem to improve the performance, and I read somewhere it's not recommended to attach a FIFOQueue after the output of iterator (from iterator.make_initializer(data_set)).
Thanks in advance for your insights
